result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael R. Blank

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael R. Blank in court with attorney Rodman Wells Streicher.  Defendant Michael R. Blank in custody.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Calling 16cf4,16cf41,16cf66,16cf160 and 15tr3296,16tr308
State moves to dismiss  but read in 16cf4,16cf41 and 16cf160 and counts 2,3,5,6 in 16cf66 , and dismiss 15tr3296 and 16tr308 - Granted

3:14 p.m. Defendant Michael R. Blank in court with attorney Rodman Wells Streicher.  Defendant Michael R. Blank in custody.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cf66, 16cf04, 16cf41, 16cf160, 15tr3296 and 16tr308. Court notes jury trial scheduled in 16cf04. Streicher - believes global resolution has been reached - requests plea and sentencing date. Plea/Sentencing will be held in first floor hearing room. Bail continued. Adj. 3:17 p.m.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 21, 2017 at 10:30 am.

3:11 p.m. Defendant Michael R. Blank in court with attorney Rodman Wells Streicher.  Defendant Michael R. Blank in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf211, 16cf04, 16cf41,16cf66, 16cf160, 15tr3296 and 16tr308. Streicher - State has made an offer - Defendant is not willing to accept - requests jury trial. Court schedules revocation hearing in 15cf211 for October 26, 2016 at 3:30 p.m. Court schedules 2-day jury trial in 16cf04 for February 1 and February 2, 2017 at 8:30 each day. Pre-trial conference scheduled for Tuesday, January 17, 2017 at 2:30 p.m. Status conference in all other cases. Bail continued. Adj. 3:18 p.m.  Status conference scheduled for January 17, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

10:08 a.m. Defendant Michael R. Blank in court, in custody, with attorney Rodman Wells Streicher.  Mary Margaret Sowinski, Asst. DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16CF66, 15TR3296, 15CF211, 16CF160, 16CF41, 16CF4. Sowinski statement--procedural issue with 16CF41, 16CF4, preliminary hearing had not been scheduled. Defendant waives preliminary hearing in 16CF41, 16CF4; waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Information filed in 16CF41 and 16CF4. Sowinski statement--waiting on outstanding restitution on one case; hopeful for global resolution on all cases. Streicher in receipt of Information; pleads not guilty. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm. (bb)

2:37p.m.  Defendant Michael R. Blank in court with attorney Rodman Wells Streicher.  Defendant Michael R. Blank in custody.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cf160, 16cf66, 16tr308, 16cf04, 16cf41. In 16cf160. In 16cf160 - Sowinski statement that prelminary hearing has not been held - willing to provide discovery. Streicher -   In receipt of complaint, waive reading - enters not guilty pleas - wants to proceed to waiver of prelminary hearing.   Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Streicher - willing to proceed to arraignment - Sowinski statement - Intent to file Information with 24 hours that mirrors complaint. Streicher - enters not guilty pleas. Streicher requests pre-trial conference in all matters. Streicher motion to modify bond - defendant's mother passed away and that is why he did not report to jail. Court does not modify bond previously set. 
Bail continued. Adj. 2:46 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 21, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 14, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

Defendant Michael R. Blank in court with attorney .  Defendant Michael R. Blank in custody via video.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ALso calling 16CF41, 16CF66 16CF4,16CF211, 16TR308 and 15TR3296.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel.  ADA Sowinski to bail asks for significant cash bail on all cases.  Court sets $20,000 cash bond (Done in 16cf160).  Court date to be set in front of Judge Bloom
Per Mary now in ONSO - brought over by Lock and Load
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter
per Nichole @ ONSO - detainer - Washington Cty MN

4:07 p.m. Defendant not in court. Attorney Rodman Wells Streicher in court.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 16cf66, 15cf211, 16cf04, 16cf41, 16tr308 and 15tr3296. Streicher statement to defendant's whereabouts. State requests warrant - Court authorizes warrant in all cases. Adj. 4:10 p.m.

2:33 p.m. Defendant Michael R. Blank, in custody, in court via video with attorney Rodman Wells Streicher.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cf04, 16cf41, 15tr3296 and 16tr308.   In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Preliminary hearing is already scheduled. Time limits waived
. Defendant is having heart surgery tomorrow. Preliminary hearing is rescheduled. Defendant requests furlough from jail for surgery. Stricher statement to furlough. Court will have JA contact jail regarding furlough. 
Bail continued. Adj. 2:38 p.m.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

3:02 p.m. Defendant Michael R. Blank in court in custody via video with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cf04, 16cf41, 16tr308, 15tr3296. Bennett statement to conflict; needs to contact PD's office for appointment of new attorney - Bail continued in all cases. Adj. 3:04 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Michael R. Blank
Current: 10088 St Hwy 32, Argonne, WI 54511 United States  (Effective: 02-23-2016)
Prior: 2967 Cranes Road, Apt. C2, Rhinelander, WI 54501

Defendant Michael R. Blank in court with attorney John Michael Schellpfeffer.  Steven Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. In 15cf211 - State moves to amend to Possession of Cocaine, a violation of 961.41(3g)(c) - A Misdemeanor - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters guilty plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Michlig/Schellpfeffer/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
WHS/POP - 1 year
Jail - 30 days with Huber for all purposes. May serve in Forest or Outagamie Counties. Court allows electronic monitoring if jail rules allow. To commence on/before Friday, April 22, 2016 at 4 p.m. 
Jail credit - 
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
AODA Assessment and follow-through.
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given.

Calling 16cf41-Schellpfeffer appearing specially today. Schellpfeffer statement that may not be representing - PD's office needs to appoint. Adjourned Initial Appearance scheduled for Monday, March 28, 2016 at 2:30 p.m. $2500 signature bond set. 

Calling 16cf04, 15tr3296, 16tr308 - Schellpfeffer anticipates resolution - waiting for restitution amount. Adjourned Initial Appearance scheduled for Monday, March 28, 2016 at 2:30 p.m. Adj. 3:55 p.m.
Adj. 3:55 p.m. 
  Review hearing scheduled for July 18, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
